headline: The Ukrainian family torn by war and exile behind a famous photo published by Le Monde
description: A few days after the Russian invasion, photojournalist Laurence Geai captured the farewell of a Ukrainian family at Odesa train station. Four years later, the mother welcomed Le Monde to Cologne, Germany, where she lives as a refugee with her son and her mother, far from her husband, since enlisted in the army.

headline: Secret Service kills man trying to enter Trump's Mar-a-Lago estate
France summons US ambassador over comments on slain far-right activist
The Syrian oil sector's year zero
description: By driving the Kurds out of northeastern Syria, the central government has regained control over all of the country's oil resources. However, given the poor condition of the wells, damaged by fighting and chaotic extraction, it will take several years before production returns to its pre-war level.

headline: Oleksandr Syrsky, commander of the Ukrainian army, to Le Monde: 'Russian army losses have exceeded its recruitment level'
description: The Ukrainian commander-in-chief told Le Monde that, despite a 'very difficult' situation on the battlefield, his army continued to resist 'the most powerful army in Europe' and to 'foil' Russian military plans.

headline: 2026 Winter Olympics: The most striking photos from the Games
description: The 2026 edition of the Winter Olympic Games in Milan-Cortina, Italy, was filled with outstanding performances.

headline: AI has arrived in France's local elections – for better or worse
description: From creating campaign videos to writing speeches, artificial intelligence has become an effective tool for candidates. However, it also raises ethical questions, prompting some elected officials to call for regulation.

How a messianic movement is changing the Israeli military
description: Followers of the Hardal movement, a blend of religious fundamentalism and ultranationalism, have begun to make inroads into the military establishment. Their dehumanizing rhetoric toward Palestinians has contributed to the destruction of the Gaza Strip.

headline: Serge Gainsbourg's forgotten Ukrainian roots
description: Serge Gainsbourg described himself as a Russian Jew. More precisely, his musician parents fled Tsarist Ukraine before emigrating to Paris in 1921, to escape from pogroms and the Bolsheviks. In Ukraine, where four years of war have fueled an obsession with uncovering traces of the past, some have been trying to rediscover the singer's roots.

headline: Iran expert Ross Harrison: 'Cutting off the head of the snake' would not bring down the regime
description: Ross Harrison, a nonresident scholar at the Middle East Institute and an expert on the Islamic Republic, sees a growing likelihood of a US-led intervention aimed at causing the regime to implode. However, he believes the chances of success are limited, given the particularly 'resilient' nature of the Iranian system, as he explains in an interview with Le Monde.

headline: Jean Pisani-Ferry: 'German commitment to rearmament is good news and a challenge for Europe'
'What is, ultimately, the point of sending humans into space?'
'Lawless zones around Israel are the result of the Pax Judaica made possible by uncontested military hegemony'
